sourcesContent:
import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react'; import { motion } from 'framer-motion'; import Chart from 'react-apexcharts'; import { randomIntFromInterval, generateRandomData } from './utils'; // Assuming utils.js for random data generation const MainPage = ({ toggleSidebar }) => { const [data, setData] = useState([]); const [chartData, setChartData] = useState({ cpuUsageChart: { series: [{ data: [70] }], options: { chart: { type: 'radialBar' } } }, memoryUsageChart: { series: [{ data: [50] }], options: { chart: { type: 'radialBar' } } }, responseTimeChart: { series: [{ name: 'Response Time', data: [10, 20, 15, 8] }], options: { chart: { type: 'line' } } }, activeConnectionsChart: { series: [{ data: [30] }], options: { chart: { type: 'bar' } } }, diskUsageChart: { series: [{ data: [60] }], options: { chart: { type: 'donut' } } }, errorRateChart: { series: [{ data: [5] }], options: { chart: { type: 'pie' } } }, threadUsageChart: { series: [{ data: [80] }], options: { chart: { type: 'radialBar' } } }, ioOperationsChart: { series: [{ data: [120] }], options: { chart: { type: 'line' } } }, userSessionsChart: { series: [{ data: [150] }], options: { chart: { type: 'bar' } } }, }); const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true); // To show loading state useEffect(() => { const fetchData = () => { setLoading(true); // Start loading state // Simulating dynamic, more powerful data updates (e.g., different patterns) const newCpuUsage = randomIntFromInterval(40, 90); // More realistic CPU usage const newMemoryUsage = randomIntFromInterval(30, 90); // Simulate memory usage const newResponseTimes = generateRandomData(4, 5, 25); // Simulate random response times (4 values between 5ms and 25ms) const newActiveConnections = randomIntFromInterval(10, 50); // Simulate active connections const newDiskUsage = randomIntFromInterval(50, 100); // Simulate disk usage const newErrorRate = randomIntFromInterval(1, 10); // Simulate error rate const newThreadUsage = randomIntFromInterval(50, 100); // Simulate thread usage const newIoOperations = randomIntFromInterval(100, 200); // Simulate I/O operations const newUserSessions = randomIntFromInterval(100, 300); // Simulate user sessions setChartData({ cpuUsageChart: { series: [{ data: [newCpuUsage] }], options: { chart: { type: 'radialBar' } } }, memoryUsageChart: { series: [{ data: [newMemoryUsage] }], options: { chart: { type: 'radialBar' } } }, responseTimeChart: { series: [{ name: 'Response Time', data: newResponseTimes }], options: { chart: { type: 'line' } } }, activeConnectionsChart: { series: [{ data: [newActiveConnections] }], options: { chart: { type: 'bar' } } }, diskUsageChart: { series: [{ data: [newDiskUsage] }], options: { chart: { type: 'donut' } } }, errorRateChart: { series: [{ data: [newErrorRate] }], options: { chart: { type: 'pie' } } }, threadUsageChart: { series: [{ data: [newThreadUsage] }], options: { chart: { type: 'radialBar' } } }, ioOperationsChart: { series: [{ data: [newIoOperations] }], options: { chart: { type: 'line' } } }, userSessionsChart: { series: [{ data: [newUserSessions] }], options: { chart: { type: 'bar' } } }, }); setLoading(false); // End loading state }; fetchData(); // Initial fetch const intervalId = setInterval(fetchData, 5000); // Update every 5 seconds return () => clearInterval(intervalId); // Cleanup on component unmount }, []); return (

Fetching New Data...
)} {/* Real-time Data Cards */}

CPU Usage

{chartData.cpuUsageChart.series[0].data[0]}%

{chartData.responseTimeChart.series[0].data.map((time, index) => ( Query {index + 1}: {time.toFixed(2)}ms   ))}

); }; export default MainPage;
